intro: Lithospermum bolivariense, commonly known as Bolivian lithospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Lithospermum bolivariense is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
